title: Shortcuts and email links that start up firefox, timeout/fail. If opened in new tab or Firefox is open already, they're fine. Happens with any/all sites. "Fix" is changing to auto-detect proxy settings
content:
These sites all work fine in other browsers, changing the default browser proves to be a fix.

The behavior is reproduced with A.V. removed and when tested on a network that isn't behind a firewall, one of my colleagues even has it happening on his personal home PC, completely not related to our company firewall or A.V.

Oddly, it isn't universal. I don't have it happening on my PC and can't figure out for the life of me what makes my firefox or anything else any different--I'm on the same profile on the other machines where its reproduced.

Changing connection settings to auto-detect proxy settings for the network reduces load time for these shortcuts/links to about 6 seconds (trying to improve that to immediate, to prevent users from changing to another browser--trying to give firefox a chance to continue competing).

This isn't happening on every single PC for some reason, but a good portion of them. Seems to have started up as people got to version 98.0.1

I've already tried changing the about:config flags of network.dns.disableIPv6 and network.dns.disablePrefetch to true, nothing changed. Changing the checkbox for enable DNS over https also has no impact.

This happens on fresh installs of firefox, with default settings. This has been an ongoing problem for a few weeks now.

Thanks for any time and assistance anyone can provide.
creator: t.vice

title: Firefox All Bookmarks Start-Up Folder is now "Other Bookmarks"
content:
Hi All!

Greetings and thanks for the best browser in the world!

In the past when I opened the Bookmarks, it opened at the top, "All Bookmarks".

This was the default for decades.

Now, since around update 98.0(?) it opens at the bottom, "Other Bookmarks" and there is no way for me to change it.

I had hoped the Devs would fix it, but the last two minor updates have not.

How do I fix this? Is there a way for me to tweak the "about:config" settings to get it back where it belongs?

Regards,

Mike. P.S. I'm running Firefox 98.0.2 on a Win 7 Desktop and a win 10 Laptop. The issue is the same on both.
creator: mnixon1930

title: Removal of Cut/Copy/Paste menu item breaks functionality on some webpages.
content:
At some point Mozilla removed the Cut, Copy and Paste options in Firefox which breaks functionality on some web-pages. An example is for Ubiquiti's router web interface, in their terminal, Ctrl-C is the typical Linux kill command, right click is commandeered for a terminal layout configuration menu, and the only way to past text into the webpage is to use the Paste menu item that used to be in the hamburger menu.

There are other web-pages that using the menu item is the only or best way to cut/copy/paste text.

Removal of this feature breaks those web pages.
creator: nabeelr

title: Firefox's handling of PDFs has changed - WHY?
content:
Yesterday, Firefox handled opening PDFs on a page-specific basis. In Quickbooks, when I created an invoice it would open within the browser in Quickbooks' own mini-window. When I went to my shipping company and clicked "PRINT/VIEW" to open a PDF for the bill of lading, it would ask me whether I wanted to open in the browser or in Acrobat (which we want the latter because we need to adjust print settings).

Now, Firefox applies the same handling of PDFs to ALL web pages regardless of how they handled it before. I have tried going into application settings and trying every different possible setting and it applies it globally, making life much more difficult.

If I choose Open in Firefox, when I go to print freight BOLs and labels it opens the PDF in the browser, and there's no option with the plugin to open in Adobe. I literally have to save the file, go find where it was saved, then open it in Adobe. Apart from that it's now cluttering up my hard drive with files I don't need.

If I choose Always Ask, the Quickbooks plugin no longer works and I have to manually print my invoices now!

Someone please tell me there is a fix for this.
creator: akrywonizka

title: blocco download automatico
content:
Buongiorno, in primis, complimenti per il lavoro. Partiamo con la lamentela: la nuova versione ha imposto il download automatico di tutti i file che si scaricano. Io capisco che a forza di voler offrire qualcosa di nuovo si **** fuori dal vaso, ma dico, qualcuno ci ha davvero pensato a cosa si voleva fare ? ho/avevo impostato come cartella il desktop con obbligo di richiesta, in modo da gestire di volta in volta, ed ero la persona (complicata) più felice del mondo, con FF.

Ora questa opzione che (non sembra) disattivatile - CHIEDO AIUTO A VOI - che imputtana il desktop, a volte mi ritrovo con files doppi perchè quando li salvo rinominandoli evidentemente non gestite correttamente i temporanei .. ( ecomunque li devo andare a gestire ogni fottutissimo file, perchè l'opzione )un dramma.

Prima di cancellare FF e tutti gli annessi e passare alla concorrenza, chiedo disperatamente se c'è una strada per cancellare questa c@***ta di opzione.

Spero tanto in una risposta positiva, sono fan dalla versione 1 (o giuù di li, ho anche il diplomino per il download che fecero all'epoca :) ) ma con questa genialata è la volta che passo definitivamente alla concorrenza (mio malgrado).

Grazie Marco

title: Just opene
content:
I have logged on and opened only five tabs. I now have 13 Firefox instances. Firefox has gotten unusable. I've tried everything that Mozilla and others recommend. Don't bother to tell me to uncheck "Use recommended performance settings." Who hasn't don't that already. I also don't need to read that this is normal. I HATE Chrome but will have to switch to it if I cannot improve my very slow functionality. People need real solutions, not the same answer pasted into every complaint about this. Perhaps the answer is that you have no solution.

I even tried to set the autostart option to "false" as some suggest to disable multi-processes. I think that's made it worse.

I have fought this for several years but now, the situation is very much worse. I've been exiting Firefox and getting back in to stop so many processes (sure, sure, instances) but now I see 13 instances with only 5 tabs opened. Within 10 minutes, I have 13 processes running. Call them instances if you like, but they are 13 separate .exe files that are slowing me almost to a stop.

content:

Recently (in the last few days) Firefox has begun preventing me from using my AOL account citing privacy:

"Secure Connection Failed

"An error occurred during a connection to www.aol.com. PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR 

   "The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    "Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem."

Why did this start happening and what can I do about it? Curiously I can still access my AOL e-mail account on my Kindle.

Lloyd
creator: lwlietz12

title: Belgian eID don't work with FF 98.0.2 !!!
content:
Hello,

From the version 89... we have a non solutioned problem with Firefox... In Belgium, we use a "electronic Identification card" to access differents officials web site. but with Firefox I (We!!!) have a problem... the identification process loop with a message "Please insert the smart card" ??? After I receive the message: "Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to certif.iamfas.belgium.be. A PKCS #11 module returned CKR_GENERAL_ERROR, indicating that an unrecoverable error has occurred.

Error code: SEC_ERROR_PKCS11_GENERAL_ERROR"

I restart, I reinstall FF, I reinstall the eID software... no way!!! But it's work fine with Chrome, Edge,... Why not with Firefox 98.0.2 ?!? It's very important to find a solution for the belgian users, without this support, the users go to Chrome, Edge,... Have a nice day, Philippe

title: FireFox feature requests
content:
Add an option to load presets for Firefox settings. I have poor eye site. In order to read the text I am writing I have the zoom set to 170. Add to that the size and color of the icons it is difficult to tell what the icons represent. by a preset I mean when first installed give options to set toolbar height and width, select the color used or simply select black and white. Colors are pretty and icons look cool but are useless until you know what they represent. 

 This support page is black and white. Other than the fact that many of your users will need to set a high zoom it looks pretty good.

title: Impossibile avviare Firefox su Mac OS 10.15.7
content: Gentilissimi, da un paio di mesi, non è possibile lanciare Firefox sul mio Mac con OS in oggetto. Mi viene restituirto l'errore "impossibile avviare firefox". Nei vari forum che ho consultato ho trovato questa stringa: /Applications/Firefox.app/Contents/MacOS/firefox-bin -P con cui riesco ad avviarlo da terminale. Scelgo il profilo e tutto funziona perfettamente. Ma se spengo la macchina lo devo riavviare con questa procedura. Ho già provato a disinstallare e installare la versione più recente ma nulla da fare. L'ultimo step che mi rimane è formattare. Qualcuno mi dà un aiuto. Grazie. Giovanni
